humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that there is positive metastatic carcinoma in the sentinel lymph node (specimen C), but no evidence of malignancy in the axillary contents (specimen D). Therefore, based on the new rule 10 and rule 12, the N stage is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a patient is determined by the presence and extent of cancer in the lymph nodes. In this report, the pathologic N stage is pN1c. This is because there is metastatic carcinoma present in the sentinel lymph node (specimen C), but there is no evidence of malignancy in the axillary contents (specimen D). The 'c' in pN1c indicates that the metastasis is 'clinically apparent' but not 'pathologically confirmed' in the axillary lymph nodes. This is based on the absence of malignancy in specimen D. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.
